reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Siemenpuu Foundation?s programme 2022?2025 aims to improve rural communities? (over 200000 people?s) equal opportunities to develop sustainable living conditions and participate in decision-making on the state of their environment. The programme supports s trengthening the multi-voiced civil society which strives for environmental justice particularly by advancing collaboration and networking. In all projects biodiversity and climate sustainability are strengthened.Ohjelmatukihakemus A Siemenpuu ? kansalaisl iikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr ? Ohjelma vuosille 2022?20252Minimum 50 projects are funded in the programme. They are identified through calls for project proposals opened in four environmental themes. Supported projects are designed and implemented by local CSOs in target countries. Through the projects at least 200 CSOs and movements are strengthened. The programme?s five main target countries (85% of the programme?s project funding) are Kenya Liberia Mali Mozambique and Myanmar. In addition funding is pilo ted in Cambodia as well as Northern and Eastern Syria. Some on-going projects continue in Nepal. Should resources allow old partners? successful work is supported in the Brazilian Amazon Riau in Indonesia and among the Adivasi forest communities in India.T he programme?s themes are:Biocultural Rights: strengthening of indigenous and local communities? biocultural diversity by advancing the implementation of internationally acknowledged traditional rights. (particularly KEN and MMR)Energy Justice: support to sustainable energy systems serving rural communities by advancing multi-voiced energy planning and community-based energy production. (particularly MLI MMR and pilots in KHM)Feminist Agroecology: support to regional and local communities? food sovereignty by advancing peasant agroecological practices as well as land and seed rights. (particularly LBR MOZ and pilots in SYR/NES)Tropical Forests: strengthening forest communities and improving the state of forests by advancing community-based conservation susta inable use and regeneration. (particularly LBR and MOZ)The objective of the communications and global education implemented in Finland is to raise awareness on the programme themes and strengthen active citizenship for global justice.

Siemenpuu Foundation?s programme 2022?2025 aims to improve rural communities? (over 200000 people?s) equal opportunities to develop sustainable living conditions and participate in decision-making on the state of their environment. The programme supports s trengthening the multi-voiced civil society which strives for environmental justice particularly by advancing collaboration and networking. In all projects biodiversity and climate sustainability are strengthened.Ohjelmatukihakemus A Siemenpuu ? kansalaisl iikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr ? Ohjelma vuosille 2022?20252Minimum 50 projects are funded in the programme. They are identified through calls for project proposals opened in four environmental themes. Supported projects are designed and implemented by local CSOs in target countries. Through the projects at least 200 CSOs and movements are strengthened. The programme?s five main target countries (85% of the programme?s project funding) are Kenya Liberia Mali Mozambique and Myanmar. In addition funding is pilo ted in Cambodia as well as Northern and Eastern Syria. Some on-going projects continue in Nepal. Should resources allow old partners? successful work is supported in the Brazilian Amazon Riau in Indonesia and among the Adivasi forest communities in India.T he programme?s themes are:Biocultural Rights: strengthening of indigenous and local communities? biocultural diversity by advancing the implementation of internationally acknowledged traditional rights. (particularly KEN and MMR)Energy Justice: support to sustainable energy systems serving rural communities by advancing multi-voiced energy planning and community-based energy production. (particularly MLI MMR and pilots in KHM)Feminist Agroecology: support to regional and local communities? food sovereignty by advancing peasant agroecological practices as well as land and seed rights. (particularly LBR MOZ and pilots in SYR/NES)Tropical Forests: strengthening forest communities and improving the state of forests by advancing community-based conservation susta inable use and regeneration. (particularly LBR and MOZ)The objective of the communications and global education implemented in Finland is to raise awareness on the programme themes and strengthen active citizenship for global justice.
